_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Description

Acetylene Oxygen Company located at Sinton, Texas is an acetylene gas plant that manufactures, stores, handles and distributes acetylene that is regulated by the EPA's Risk Management Program rule.



Regulated Substances

This facility uses, manufactures, or stores a chemical listed in part 68 of Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations, beyond a threshold quantity, as established by the EPA; 

- Acetylene, as part of a production and distribution process



Accidental Release Prevention Policy

AOC-Sinton has a policy to check the equipment regularly, that minimize the possibility of accidental chemical releases and operational safety programs that ensure safe operations at the facility.



Prevention Program 

AOC-Sinton has a comprehensive accident prevention program in place following OSHA's Process Safety Management standards and EPA's Risk Management Program rules. This program consists of process safety issues, which includes following information:

- Technical documentation of Process Safety Information, describing the physical properties of the hazardous substances, the safety systems in place to control these substances, and the standard operating procedures associated with all equipment and systems.

- Procedures and programs to develop, maintain, and control key program elements such as process operations, equipment mechanical integrity, employee training, management of change, hot work permits, incident investigation, and contractor activity.

 - Initial and regular review of new or modified processes that include Process Hazard Analysis study and pre-startup review. 



Chemical-specific Prevention Steps 

The acetylene generator is equipped with an alarm system which alerts when any abnormal operations within the generator. The alarm system alerts when low/high water input and high temperature in the generator. The acetylene plant is equipped with pressure relief valves. The facility also employs emergency trip station that h

alts acetylene generator process in the event of an emergency.



Five-year Accident History

The AOC-Sinton facility accident history indicates continuous safe operation of all covered chemical processes over the last five years. There were no covered process releases that resulted in an EPA RMP recordable accident.



Emergency Response Programs

All facility employees are trained in their role in the emergency plan and have access to a map identifying the exit routes. The Sinton Fire Department agency has a listing of the hazardous materials at this facility and a facility map identifying the production and storage areas for these materials. 



Planned Changes to Improve Safety 

AOC-Sinton constantly improves the safety of the processes using recommendations developed through the prevention program and safety suggestions from the employees. There are currently no major planned changes to improve safety.
